page.title: 16THE SCHOOL COMPUTER
page.content: The Domesday Data is stored in our BBC microcomputer.Computers in schools are new,we have had our computer for a year now.Our computer has a 32K Ram memory and a 32K Rom memory it has a keyboard it has connections for a tape recorder,a disc drive,a printer,and a monitor.At first we had a tape recorder,it took a long time to load programs and made a lot of noise.Now we have a disc drive it is quicker and quieter. We have a trolley and a colour monitor. With the trolley we can wheel it from class to class and with the colour monitor we can see the graphics better.We asked the children in our class if they had a computer at home .Just over half of them had.The most popular are the BBC with 3 children and the Spectrum with 2 and Dragon and Commador with 2 each.
